alert.note: Alert for Daviess (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 25 at 2:49AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Indiana, including the following counties, Daviess, Greene, Knox and Sullivan. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 247 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported ongoing flooding in the warned area due recent heavy rain. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Vincennes, Washington, Bicknell, Lyons, Carlisle, Elnora, Oaktown, Wheatland, Bruceville, Plainville, Sandborn, Montgomery, Edwardsport, Merom, Cannelburg, Alfordsville, Freelandville, Pleasantville, Paxton and Vincennes University. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
